channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024010819
item.description:
Report X-2024010819

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered and placed in a spill tote, but the person who found it failed to immediately notify qualified personnel and package was left for about an hour before it was discovered by QA. Package was then immediately moved to a hazmat tote and liner and taken to be processed. Package had been promptly put into a spill liner so there was no mess to clean up in the surroundings. DescribePack: Caps were loose and spun freely when interacted with. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in spill liner/tote

item.title: Report X-2024010737
item.description:
Report X-2024010737

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET, DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS. CONTENTS DEEMED AS 4 X 1LITER PLASTIC BOTTLES OF VIDEOJET CLEANING SOLUTION. ENTIRE PACKAGE FAILED DUE TO LOSE BOTTLE CAPS, CAUSING AN INTERNAL LEAKAGE LEAVING GOODS DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE. DescribePack: FAILED DUE TO LOOSE BOTTLE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2024010560
item.description:
Report X-2024010560

  • State: IN

  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH facility a plastic jerrican fell off the rollers. The plastic jerrican was punctured on top by the cap resulting in a spill . The jerrican was placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024010539
item.description:
Report E-2024010539

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading tanker with UN 1993 material the operator went to blow air into the hoses to clear out any material. The tanker had too much material in it and that action caused about 5 gallons of material to leak out from the top dome (which was closed but not secured). Employees cleaned up the mess in house as all material was in secondary containment and nothing went offsite. Hoses were then hooked up to the tanker and material was backed out of the tanker. Employees were retrained that these on checking to make sure there is ample room left while filling the tanker.

item.title: Report E-2024020018
item.description:
Report E-2024020018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: VINCENNES
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XVN experienced a UN3017 Loveland Dimethoate 400 Insecticide release from a 270-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to a 1’ x 4’ area of the concrete and trailer floor due to a container failure; the top buckled and cracked as a result. The material was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and sanitizer. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
